title: China Stocks Rally Led by AI Firms Amid Regulatory Calm
description: China's stock market experienced gains, primarily driven by artificial-intelligence companies, following regulatory interventions to temper excessive market enthusiasm. The CSI300 and Shanghai Composite Indexes made moderate progress, while Hong Kong's Hang Seng dipped slightly. Onshore AI stocks rebounded with semiconductors, amid ongoing regulatory scrutiny of abnormal trading activity.
content: China's stock market saw an uptick on Wednesday, largely propelled by artificial-intelligence enterprises. This rise came after regulatory bodies intervened to mitigate the month's rampant market enthusiasm. Meanwhile, Hong Kong shares experienced a ... [679 chars]

title: How attending the ET AI Awards strengthens your AI point of view as a business leader
description: In an environment where artificial intelligence is shaping competitive advantage, leaders need more than surface-level awareness. This article explores how attending the ET AI Awards sharpens a CXOs AI point of view by enabling informed judgment, peer-led learning, and strategic clarity. The outcome is not inspiration alone, but a stronger leadership voice grounded in real enterprise use cases and decision-making.

title: ‘Only months behind’: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis issues stark warning on China’s AI rise
description: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis has warned that China is now only “months behind” leading AI powers, highlighting how rapidly the country is advancing in artificial intelligence.
content: The US enjoying it’s lead in the AI race might not be for very long. According to Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google, Deepmind the Chinese AI models are now only “a matter of months” behind their US and Western counterparts. Demis Hassabis said this durin... [2296 chars]

title: Nvidia CEO Huang plans to visit China as he seeks to reopen market, Bloomberg reports
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang plans to travel to China in late January as he seeks to reopen a critical market for the company's artificial intelligence chips, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing a person familiar with the matter.
content:
Huang is expected to attend company events ahead of the Lunar New Year holidays in February, and may also visit Beijing, according to the report.
Sign up here.
Reuters could not immediately verify the report. Nvidia declined to comment.

title: Foreign funds return to Indian tech stocks on AI growth bets
description: Foreign investors are returning to Indian IT stocks, driven by the rising adoption of artificial intelligence and improved business visibility. Companies such as TCS, Infosys and HCL Tech are seeing strong AI-led growth, reviving sector sentiment despite near-term earnings pressure and uneven performance across firms.
